CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1952, pg. 20 reads: "Old And The New - A city of Pittsburgh Highways and Sewers crew hauls away the last remnants of one of the Hill District's worse hokey piles at the corner of Webster Avenue and Crawford Street this week just after one of the news Dempster Dumpsters, into which residents are now being asked to dump all of their refuse, was placed on the lot. Dempsters Dumpsters are being placed at the locations of all hokey piles. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: City of Pittsburgh Highways and Sewers crew shoveling garbage into Pittsburgh Department of Public Works truck, in front of Amoco gas station, corner of Webster Avenue and Crawford Street, Hill District
